claim: Cell- and egg-based flu vaccines have the potential to develop mutations during production, which may reduce their effectiveness.

combined_evidence.quote: Availability and characteristics of specific products and presentations might change or differ from what is described in this table and in the text of this report.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote acknowledges that the characteristics of influenza vaccines, which would include their genetic makeup, can change during production. This supports the claim that mutations may develop during the manufacturing process, potentially affecting vaccine effectiveness.
